moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nc3: The Vienna game my favourite opening.
moves.2... c6 3. f4 exf4 4. Nf3 b5 5. d4 Nf6 6: This only makes matters worse.  Black needed to develop ( i would have played 7(Bb7)) and also the bishop is needed to exchange on d6. 7 Bb7 needed trying eg 7 Bb7 8 Ne4  Be7 9 Nd6+  Bxd6 black has time to castle.
moves.8. Ne4 Qb4+ 9. Bd2 Qxb2 10. a3: White is threatening to win the queen with Bc3.
moves.12... Nxd1 13. Bxa3: A piece for two pawns up white also threatens Nd6+ etc
moves.14. Nd6+ Ke7 15. Nxc8+: Double check. White has another piece in the bag.  Two pieces up the game should no longer be a contest.
moves.15... Kd8 16. Nd6: White can win a rook. Black can win a rook.
moves.20. Bc4: To remove Blacks only active piece.
moves.22... Rf8 23. Ra4xa5 Rxa5 24. Rxa5 Nxg2: Attempting a mating finish 27 bc 28 Bxc3+ Ka4 29 Ra7+ Na6 30 Rxa6+mate.
moves.27... Na6 28. cxb4+ Nxb4 29. Bc3 fxe5 30: 31 Ra8 would have forced white to coordinate the pieces 31 Ra8 32 Bb3+ Ka3 33 Nc4+mate.
moves.32. Ra7#: 2 c6 is playable but 7 Qe7 set black too many problems.
